Description: Fragment of a marble bead-and-reel moulding with one bead and two reels. Also, traces of red paint were found on the grey and glazed marble.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'second temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: The angle between the relief ground and the minimal remains of the ashlar surface corresponds with B 415. However the fragments do not join. Published (Koenigs 2007, 329, Cat. 14; Petrie 1886, 14 No. 18, Pl. 14 A; Altekamp 138 No. 2)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B416)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.14, p.329, pl. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.23) (Phase 3)
